IS590DVO - Data Visualization

This is the course website for IS590 Data Visualization in Spring 2019 (Online)

  • View On GitHub

IS590DVO - Data Visualization

This is the course website for Data Visualization, instructed by Jill P. Naiman (jnaiman@illinois.edu).

Please note: Chrome (and possibly Firefox) are the necessary browsers for success with Blackboard Collaborate! Also: a “headset” type setup is needed for this class (apple-type earbuds can produce a lot of feedback).

Moodle page is located here.

Below, you will find the materials for each week, as well as a syllabus that includes contact information and a course outline.

References

Some handy references you might appreciate:

  • matplotlib tutorial
  • python tutorial
  • Effective Computation in Physics by Scopatz & Huff (available through Safari at UIUC)
  • Markdown Cheat Sheet

  • Jupyter Cheat Sheet

  • Shared Slack Channel

Course syllabus

Weekly Lectures and Materials

  • Syllabus
  • Week 1 - Introduction
  • Week 2 - Data Storage and Operations
  • Week 3 - Data Operations and Elements of a Visualization
  • Week 4 - Elements of Viz and Distributions
  • Week 5 - Types of Viz and Choosing Colors
  • Week 6 - Comparisons, Elements, Engines and More
  • Week 7 - Beginning Interactivity
  • Week 8 - Engines and More Interactivity
  • Week 9 - More on Maps and Network Visualization
  • Week 10 - Iterative Design, Idyll
  • Week 11 - More Idyll & Interactive Web viz, Publishing
  • Week 12 - Scientific Viz
  • Week 13 - Graphics, Volumes, D3.js & How to learn new webdev things
  • Week 14 - Final Projects
